response.answer_text: Factory ones usually are but I don't know about parts store ones if you get original equipment from GM or Ford or whatever it is that you're driving it's going to have the numbers on it but if you get it from a parts store it probably will not have the numbers it'll just be black

They're not usually stamped or marked with numbers or letters but they're arranged in a certain order and that would be the firing order. Google your engine and the correct firing order and it will show the location of the coil for your vehicle
Not usually intrinsically numbered. As soon as you install them on the engine however it’s common to refer to them as “number 3 coil” or similar. Same story for plugs and injectors.
